answers.answer: I've went to the er last friday and they said I need to drink more water. I was having contrations the whole time but didnt dialate any so they sent me home. I have drank so much water the past two days and my swelling is still bad. I called the doctor today and they told me to check my blood pressure and if its not over 130/90 then just get bed rest, it was 120/80. When I do have bed rest the swelling goes down but I can get up to just go to the bathroom and it swells so bad fast. Im just worried.

Swelling can be common in pregnancy and you can be retaining water. You do have symptoms of pre eclampsia,  but you are missing 2 key factors, high blood pressure and protein in your urine. I would just keep your doctor up to date on how you feel, weight gain and I am sure they will watch you close and check you often for your bp and any protein.

It sounds just like regular pregnancy swelling to me. If your blood pressure is good and no protein in your urine you should be fine, those are the two major signs. My blood pressure has been rising since I was 20 weeks and I've been around 142/86. They're watching me but no bed rest yet thankfully.

question: I am 35 weeks and am experiencing swelling in my legs, feet, ankles, toes and sometimes hands and fingers. I have also had rapid weight gain 20 pounds in three weeks, 7 for those in just two days. I haven't had to high of blood pressure it was 120/84 yesterday. My doctor ordered a 24 hour urine collection the nurse called this morning and said the results came back normal.What does that mean?Why am I having so much swelling and weight gain? Any ideas?
title: Is it preeclampsia? please help!
